HDCN-- Calculators, GFR / 1.73 m² by MDRD (± SUN and SAlb) Calculator. Available at: http://www.hdcn.com/calcf/gfr.htm. Accessed May, 2012.
Levey AS, Bosch JP, Lewis JB, Greene T, Rogers N, Roth D. A more accurate method to estimate glomerular filtration rate from serum creatinine: A new prediction equation. Modification of Diet in Renal Disease Study Group. Ann Intern Med 1999; 130: 461-70
Levey AS, Coresh J, Greene T, Stevens LA, Zhang YL, Hendriksen S, Kusek JW, Van Lente F; Chronic Kidney Disease Epidemiology Collaboration. Using standardized serum creatinine values in the modification of diet in renal disease study equation for estimating glomerular filtration rate.Ann Intern Med. 2006 Aug 15; 145 (4): 247-54.
NKDEP - National Kideny Disease Education Program, GFR Calculators. Available at: http://www.nkdep.nih.gov/lab-evaluation/gfr-calculators.shtml. Accessed May, 2012.
Schwartz GJ, Muñoz A, Schneider MF, et al. New equations to estimate GFR in children with CKD. J Am Soc Nephrol. 2009: 20 (3): 629-37.
Schwartz GJ and Work DF. Measurement and estimation of GFR in children and adolescents. Clin J Am Soc Nephrol. 2009; 4 (11): 1832-43.
Colin C. Geddes, Yook Mun Woo, Stefan Brady, Glomerular filtration rate—what is the rationale and justification of normalizing GFR for body surface area?, Nephrology Dialysis Transplantation, Volume 23, Issue 1, January 2008, Pages 4–6, https://doi.org/10.1093/ndt/gfm662

details.purpose: *To record the estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) of an individual. (en)
details.use:
*Use to record the estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) of an individual.
There are multiple formulas used to calculate the eGFR. The formula used to calculate the eGFR can be recorded in the Protocol.
It is also possible to record the method of recording - either calculated and directly entered by the clinician or calculated and entered by the clinical software system. (en)
details.misuse: *Not to be used to record values of formula components, such as creatinine. These should be recorded using archetypes designed for this purpose, such as OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result. (en)

details.purpose: *To record the estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) of an individual. (en)
details.use:
*Use to record the estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) of an individual.
There are multiple formulas used to calculate the eGFR. The formula used to calculate the eGFR can be recorded in the Protocol.
It is also possible to record the method of recording - either calculated and directly entered by the clinician or calculated and entered by the clinical software system. (en)
details.misuse: *Not to be used to record values of formula components, such as creatinine. These should be recorded using archetypes designed for this purpose, such as OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result. (en)

details.purpose: *To record the estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) of an individual. (en)
details.use:
*Use to record the estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) of an individual.
There are multiple formulas used to calculate the eGFR. The formula used to calculate the eGFR can be recorded in the Protocol.
It is also possible to record the method of recording - either calculated and directly entered by the clinician or calculated and entered by the clinical software system. (en)
details.misuse: *Not to be used to record values of formula components, such as creatinine. These should be recorded using archetypes designed for this purpose, such as OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result. (en)

details.purpose: To record the estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) of an individual.
details.use:
Use to record the estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) of an individual.
There are multiple formulas used to calculate the eGFR. The formula used to calculate the eGFR can be recorded in the Protocol.
It is also possible to record the method of recording - either calculated and directly entered by the clinician or calculated and entered by the clinical software system.
details.misuse: Not to be used to record values of formula components, such as creatinine. These should be recorded using archetypes designed for this purpose, such as OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result. Not to be used to record the directly measured Glomerular filtration rate - Use the OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result for this purpose.

details.purpose: *To record the estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) of an individual. (en)
details.use:
*Use to record the estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) of an individual.
There are multiple formulas used to calculate the eGFR. The formula used to calculate the eGFR can be recorded in the Protocol.
It is also possible to record the method of recording - either calculated and directly entered by the clinician or calculated and entered by the clinical software system. (en)
details.misuse: *Not to be used to record values of formula components, such as creatinine. These should be recorded using archetypes designed for this purpose, such as OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result. (en)

items.items: *Calculated estimate of glomerular filtration rate as an indicator of renal function. (en)

*Chronic Kidney Disease Epidemiology Collaboration formula using creatinine. (en)
*Estimated creatinine clearance rate (eCCr) using Cockcroft-Gault formula. (en)
*Bedside IDMS-traceable Schwartz GFR Calculator for Children. (en)
*Estimation of glomerular filtration rate calculated using the relative eGFR, weight and height. (en)
*Chronic Kidney Disease Epidemiology Collaboration formula using cystatin C. (en)
*Chronic Kidney Disease Epidemiology Collaboration formula using creatinine and cystatin C. (en)
